title: Parts of Speech
content: Understanding parts of speech is fundamental to grammar. Each word in a sentence has a specific function that helps convey meaning clearly.
fullContent:
Understanding parts of speech is fundamental to grammar. Each word in a sentence has a specific function that helps convey meaning clearly.

Eight Parts of Speech:
• Nouns (people, places, things)
• Pronouns (replace nouns)
• Verbs (action or state of being)
• Adjectives (describe nouns)
• Adverbs (describe verbs, adjectives, other adverbs)
• Prepositions (show relationships)
• Conjunctions (connect words/phrases)
• Interjections (express emotion)

Examples:
• Noun: The cat sleeps peacefully.
• Verb: The cat sleeps peacefully.
• Adjective: The black cat sleeps.
• Adverb: The cat sleeps peacefully.
subject: English

title: Reading Comprehension Strategies
content: Effective reading comprehension involves active engagement with text. Good readers use strategies to understand and remember what they read.
fullContent:
Effective reading comprehension involves active engagement with text. Good readers use strategies to understand and remember what they read.

Comprehension Strategies:
• Previewing (look at title, headings, pictures)
• Predicting (what might happen next)
• Questioning (ask questions while reading)
• Summarizing (main ideas in your own words)
• Visualizing (create mental pictures)
• Making connections (to your own life, other texts)

Types of Questions:
• Literal (direct facts from text)
• Inferential (reading between the lines)
• Evaluative (forming opinions and judgments)
subject: English

title: Creative Writing Techniques
content: Creative writing allows expression of imagination and ideas. Various techniques help writers create engaging and meaningful stories.
fullContent:
Creative writing allows expression of imagination and ideas. Various techniques help writers create engaging and meaningful stories.

Writing Techniques:
• Show, don't tell (use vivid descriptions)
• Dialogue (character conversations)
• Sensory details (sight, sound, smell, taste, touch)
• Figurative language (similes, metaphors)
• Character development (personality, background)
• Plot structure (beginning, middle, end)

Types of Creative Writing:
• Short stories
• Poetry
• Personal narratives
• Descriptive essays
• Character sketches
subject: English

title: Literature Analysis
content: Learn to analyze literature by examining themes, characters, plot, and literary devices used by authors.
fullContent:
Learn to analyze literature by examining themes, characters, plot, and literary devices used by authors.

Literary Elements:
• Plot (story structure)
• Character (personalities, development)
• Setting (time and place)
• Theme (main message)
• Point of view (narrator perspective)

Literary Devices:
• Simile and metaphor
• Personification
• Alliteration
• Foreshadowing
• Irony
• Symbolism
subject: English

title: Vocabulary Development
content: Building vocabulary is essential for effective communication. Learn strategies to expand your word knowledge.
fullContent:
Building vocabulary is essential for effective communication. Learn strategies to expand your word knowledge.

Vocabulary Strategies:
• Context clues (using surrounding words)
• Word roots and affixes
• Synonyms and antonyms
• Word families
• Dictionary skills
• Word games and puzzles

Vocabulary Categories:
• Academic vocabulary
• Subject-specific terms
• Figurative language
• Multiple meaning words
• Word origins
subject: English
